title.narrative: Developing performance-based design for foundation systems of WIND turbines in AFRICA (WindAfrica)

description.narrative: Africa is facing the challenge of generating more power to meet existing and future demand. Currently, about one-half Africa's total population is lacking access to electricity. However, the continent is well endowed with renewable energy resources; it is estimated that about 35% of the world resources for wind energy are located in the continent. There are many challenges which hinder the development of infrastructure for wind energy in Africa. Designing suitable foundations to sustain the loads typically applied by wind turbines represents a particular challenge. Most potential locations for wind turbines in Africa are in tropical zones where fluctuation in ground water level is severe. The cycling of water levels means that many deposits of interest are unsaturated for at least part of the year. Unsaturated soils exhibit complex mechanical behaviour, coupled to changes in water content. This research aims to provide design for the foundations of wind turbines in unsaturated soils.

This proposal focuses on the foundation systems of wind turbines on unsaturated soils. The main objectives are: 1. To perform, field tests and centrifuge tests on the dynamic response of pile foundations in unsaturated media. These tests aim to study: (i) the response of the soil to combined quasi-static and dynamic loading, including the transmission of vibrations through the soil and (ii) the change in unsaturated soil response due to a large number of cycles of the combined quasi-static/dynamic loads. 2. To perform an extensive laboratory study, of samples of soils taken from potential wind energy locations in Africa, and to characterise the unsaturated soil response under cyclic loads. 3. To develop a numerical analysis code to replicate the centrifuge and field experiments and to allow detailed studies to be performed rapidly on foundations with various geometries. 4. To develop a simplified semi-analytical model for foundation deformation and bearing capacity. 5. To provide foundation design guidelines for wind turbines in Africa.
